meanings.definition: To suffer violent involuntary contraction of the muscles.
meanings.sent1: During the scary movie, the character convulses in fear.
meanings.sent2: The earthquake caused the ground to convulse violently.
meanings.sent3: The toy robot convulses comically when its batteries are low.
meanings.sent4: The stormy sea convulses like a giant, angry beast.
meanings.sent5: The electric shock made his whole body convulse uncontrollably.

meanings.sent1: The cold wind made the leaves convulse on the tree branches.
meanings.sent2: The old washing machine convulses noisily during the spin cycle.
meanings.sent3: The nervous puppy convulses with excitement when its owner comes home.
meanings.sent4: The ground convulses beneath our feet during the earthquake.
meanings.sent5: Her laughter made her whole body convulse with joy.

meanings.definition: To be seized by violent emotion.
meanings.sent1: She convulses with anger whenever someone mentions her ex-boyfriend.
meanings.sent2: The crowd convulses with excitement as the band takes the stage.
meanings.sent3: The toddler convulses with laughter at the silly clown.
meanings.sent4: His heart convulses with sorrow as he reads the sad news.
meanings.sent5: The room convulses with tension as the two rivals face off.
